intro: Faramea oaxacensis, commonly known as the Oaxacan faramea, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its clustered, small white flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in tropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
